channel.title: Help
channel.description:
i have made a rsps and i think its online but when my friend logs on it the black box appears then it turns off and nothing loads up any ideas why?
the code for the client when i edit it is:
@echo off java -Xmx512m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
this is the code and when he opens this it turns off any ideas why?

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @King_Joey King Joey
item.description:
@King_Joey wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:11, topic:451857”][quote author=JDfire link=topic=554748.msg4063089#msg4063089 date=1343603972]

The VM that you have doesn’t support it.

whats vm?
[/quote]

Virtual Machine. It’s because of the Java update version you have is probably update 6, whereas this byte code has been compiled with a higher version of JDK. So either delete all of the .class files in your client, and recompile it, or update your JDK to 7.[/quote]

so if he updates his JDK to 7. will that for sure make everyone go on now possiby?

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“JDfire, post:10, topic:451857”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=554748.msg4062974#msg4062974 date=1343593827]
The VM that you have doesn’t support it.
[/quote]

whats vm?[/quote]

Virtual Machine. It’s because of the Java update version you have is probably update 6, whereas this byte code has been compiled with a higher version of JDK. So either delete all of the .class files in your client, and recompile it, or update your JDK to 7.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @JDfire JDfire
item.description:

The VM that you have doesn’t support it.

whats vm?

item.title: Help

item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

The VM that you have doesn’t support it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Mango52 Mango52
item.description:
@Mango52 wrote:

Nice, a useful error message. I’m not familiar with UnsupportedClassVersion errors, but some research found that it could be a compiler/runtime incompatibility. Could you post your compile.bat code?

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @JDfire JDfire
item.description:
@JDfire wrote:

it says:

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: Gui : Unsuppo
rted major.minor version 51.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: Gui. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Mango52 Mango52
item.description:
@Mango52 wrote:

Change the run.bat to what I posted, and try it again. It lets you see the error.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @JDfire JDfire
item.description:
@JDfire wrote:

their is an error but u cannot see it as it turns of when u double click on run client so i dont know whats wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Mango52 Mango52
item.description:
@Mango52 wrote:

Change to:

@echo off java -Xmx512m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause

That way, you can see the error it’s giving.

Read full topic
